qas.question: What did John XXIII call for?
When was the decision made for this council?
Where was the decision made for this council?

answers.text: the Basilica of Saint Paul Outside the Walls

qas.question: Who did Cardinal Giovanni Battista Montini later become?
What did Pope Paul VI call for?

plausible_answers.text: a comprehensively revised liturgy, a stronger emphasis on ecumenism, and a new approach to the world

qas.question: What changes were made by the Council of Trent?
Who did Giulio Bevilacqua later become?
In what century was Catholocism popular?
How many years had passed since Giulio Bevilacqua called for the First Vatican Council?

context: Far from being a mere "stopgap" pope, to great excitement, John XXIII called for <a0_0><b4_0>an ecumenical council<b4_0/><a0_0/> <b8_0>fewer than ninety years<b8_0/> after the First Vatican Council (Vatican I's predecessor, the Council of Trent, had been held in <b7_0>the 16th century<b7_0/>). This decision was announced on <a1_0>29 January 1959<a1_0/> at <a2_0>the Basilica of Saint Paul Outside the Walls<a2_0/>. Cardinal Giovanni Battista Montini, who later became <a3_0><b6_0>Pope Paul VI<b6_0/><a3_0/>, remarked to Giulio Bevilacqua that "this holy old boy doesn't realise what a hornet's nest he's stirring up". From the Second Vatican Council came changes that reshaped the face of Catholicism: <b5_0>a comprehensively revised liturgy, a stronger emphasis on ecumenism, and a new approach to the world<b5_0/>.
